title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message:
Board works fine with WiFi cable unplugged (from J3501), and also works fine when WiFi cable is connected IF U3540 is removed. Everything else works well, no issues in ASD. Replaced with known-good U3540 (before I realized that ANY U3540 being in place caused it to turn off), and no dice. No liquid damage, board simply began powering off during boot-up one day (according to previous tech notes).

Thanks in advance for any assistance.

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message:
Uhm, is this the same board? 
[url]https://www.rossmanngroup.com/boards/forum/board-repair-troubleshooting/6993-820-3115-powers-off-as-soon-as-j3501-cable-is-connected[/url]

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message: Nope. I actually saw that thread, which prompted me to remove U3540, but that thread had no resolution, so...

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message: You did try with another cable and card?

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message: Yes, correct. I tested the board in all 3 of my "known-good" test assembly housings.

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message: Does APT work when you go into the boot menu when holding ALT key?

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message: It doesn't make it that far if I have APT plugged in, unfortunately. Cuts off before the boot menu loads.

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message: I have no idea. Q3550 maybe, just guessing at this point....

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message:
Replaced Q3550 with no change.

Bumping, hoping maybe Louis has any other suggestions? I can't find anything amiss in my measurements or testing.

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message: Remove R3500/1/2 and see if it stays on.

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message: Hey Duke, thanks. I removed R3500, R3501 and R3502 and the board still powers off, unfortunately.

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message: Try another BIOS to be sure.

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message: Thanks Duke. Tried another BIOS (file and different chip), and same issue. Could this be a PCH issue?

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message: It really doesn't leave much else. I don't see how it can shut down the system through the PCI-E lines though....

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message:
Yeah, I'm out of ideas. I even replaced the connector just now to be absolutely sure it wasn't causing issues. No change. Does the fact that the board works fine with U3540 removed just mean that it's definitely the power for APT that's causing the issue?

I might abandon this one. If anyone can solve it, I'll pay you $30.00 through PayPal. ;)

title: 820-3115, Powers off when J3501 connected.
message: I'm out of ideas for this one as well. You could try and replace the caps/coils in the data/clock lines as a last resort.
